abstract: We discuss the use of Gnuplot software as a tool to teaching physics, specifically in a physics laboratory. We show some characteristics of public domain software that has versions for all major operating systems. We show the use of this technology in teaching and learning process of mechanical experiments, where we show the adjustment functions on experimental data obtained in lecture of the physics lab. In addition, we show how to use the idea of curve fitting to find a physic model to experimental data with plotting at physics lab.
